str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To marry, used of either sex. From gamos; to wed.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To notify, command, charge, entreat solemnly. From para and the base of aggelos; to transmit a message, i.e. to enjoin.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
From chora; to place room between, i.e. Part; reflexively, to go away.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
